questions.text: A guy was playing in a garden. Suddenly, he collapsed and was rushed to the hospital. His friend who played with him in the garden informed the doctors that he ate one of the fruits in the garden post which he seemed to have developed these symptoms. He also had irritability, restlessness, dry hot skin, and was unable to pass urine and stools. Identify the poison and its appropriate antidote.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Datura, Physostigmine Irritability, restlessness, dry hot skin, and being unable to pass urine and stools (antimuscarinic poison) after having a fruit is suggestive of dhatura poisoning . An appropriate antidote for datura is Acetylcholinesterase Inhibitor Physostigmine.

Highyeild:

DHATURA - All parts of the plant are poisonous, particularly fruits and seeds. Fruit has got multiple spikes, so it is called ThornApple Fruit contains about 500 seeds and they resemble chili seeds. Active principle Hyoscine – Scopolamine Hyoscyamine Atropine Clinical features -Ds Delirium Diplopia Dimness of vision Dilatation of pupil Dryness of mouth Dysphagia Dysphonia Dilatation of cutaneous vessels Flushing of face Drunken gait Death due to Resp. failure Raised body temperature Constipation Urinary retention Associated with incoherent talks and purposeless movements → CARPHOLOGIA Pin rolling Picking up bed clothes Pulling imaginary thread – finger tips Trying to thread imaginary needle Fatal Dose: 100 – 125 seeds Fatal period : 24hours Treatment Specific Antidote - physostigmine Medicolegal Importance- Stupefying poison – Rape, Robbery, Kidnap Roadside poison

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Datura, Pralidoxime-Pralidoxime is used in organophosphorus poison. Option C. Yellow oleander, Digoxin and Option D. Yellow oleander, Physostigmine- Yellow oleander roots are poisonous, not fruit. Patients will present with cardiac symptoms, not antimuscarinic symptoms.

Extraedge:

Acts done under involuntary toxication are not held responsible under Sec.85 IPC

Table:

#MANTRA Poisoning Antidote Organophosphorus and carbamate Atropine (atropine is not used for organochlorine poisoning only organophosphorus) Atropine Physostigmine Opioids Naloxone (Intravenous) Valproate hyperammonemia Carnitine Beta blocker Glucagon Calcium channel blocker Calcium gluconate MgSO4 toxicity Calcium gluconate Na channel blocking drugs Na bicarbonate Dig oxin Dig ibind/ Digi fab Paracetamol N-Acetyl cysteine Neuroleptic Malignant syndrome Dantrolene sodium (DOC) Specific antidote if NMS due to D2 blockade-Bromocriptine Drug-induced dystonia Central anticholinergic Benzhexol Benztropine Biperiden 1st generation antihistamines Promethazine Diphenhydramine Tricyclic antidepressants NaHCO3 Sulfonylurea induced hypoglycemia Octreotide Cyanide Hydroxocobalamin Heparin.LMWH Protamine sulfate Warfarin Vitamin K Da bigatran Idarucizumab Rivaro xa b an Ap i xa ban(direct Xa inhibitor) And xa net alfa Fibrinolytic drug overdose Epsilon amino caproic acid, tranexamic acid Alco h ol , Metha n ol , Ethylene gly c ol Fomepiz ole Benzodia zep ines , Z drugs, Beta carboline Fluma ze nil Methotrexate Folinic acid/Leucovorin/Citrovorin Glucarpidase (preferred in renal failure) Methemoglobinemia Methylene blue Isoniazid induced seizure Pyridoxine Iron Acute iron poisoning- Desferioxamine Chronic iron overload- Deferiprone Deferasirox Copper Penicillamine Arsenic/lead/mercury BAL

questions.text: Farmer sleeping in a farm during harvesting season, something bites him and he wakes up to see it crawl away. He is rushed to PHC, where the doctor notices an actively bleeding wound. Which of the following is responsible?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Viper Among the above options, Viper bite can cause an actively bleeding wound, with intense local reaction at the site of bite.

Highyeild:

Viper- Viper is haemotoxic / haemolysis causing Intravascular haemolysis, depression of with intense local reaction at the site of the bite. Local Reaction There is a pain, oozing of blood ,swelling, blisters They extended to the entire limb , then to the Systemic Reaction Hemorrhage in every part from above downwards. Intracranial → conjunctival, Scleral → Middle Ear → Epistaxis → Haemoptysis → Viscera → GIT & GUT → Hematuria. Delayed Necrosis – Skin, muscles at bitten area. Death Cause of Death : Shock & Haemorrhage.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Cobra- Are neurotoxic and cause ascending paralysis with minimal (or) no local reaction at site of Bite. Option C. Wasp-Wasp stings can be painful and cause a reaction ranging from hives to breathing trouble. Option D. Scorpion- Can have severe local pain,edema and Systemic presentation can cause nausea and vomiting, Fever ,Convulsions , Cyanosis, coma.

questions.text: An investigation team reaches a crime site where the team collects the trace evidence and sends it to the forensic laboratory, where a forensic expert sees "Yellow color needle shape crystals" in microscopy. What is the test?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Barberios test Among the above given options only Barberios test shows Yellow color needle shape crystals.

Highyeild:

SEMINAL STAINS- Tests broadly divided into Chemical Tests: Acid Phosphatase Barberio’s Creatine Phosphokinase Florence Prostate specific antigen (PSA, P30) Microscopic Examination Chemical tests a. Acid phosphatase test - Secreted by prostate (prostatic epithelial cells) Activity of Acid phosphatase test in human semen is 500 – 1000 times greater than in any other body fluid. Normal acid phosphatase test activity in human semen is 340 – 360 Bodansky units per ml of semen. Concentration > 100 Bodansky units indicates that ejaculation occurred within 12 hours of examination Positive reactions are found up-to 36 hrs after ejaculation in vaginal secretions. Acid phosphatase test – conclusive test in the absence of demonstrable sperm b. Barberio’s Test- Test / reaction depends on presence of spermine which comes from prostate Reaction gives a yellow, needle shaped, rhombic crystal of spermine picrate. C. Creatine Phosphokinase (CPK) Test - CPK – found both in spermatozoa and seminal ,plasma Normal seminal fluid contains , 385 -1400 units of CPK per ml Levels > 400 units are diagnostic of seminal stains The enzyme is stable and can be demonstrated in old stains of 6 months. d. Florence Test - Tests depend on the presence of choline in semen which comes from seminal vesicles. Choline is responsible for bluish – white fluorescence of seminal stains under UV light. Positive test gives dark brown, rhombic or needle shaped crystals of choline iodide, which resemble hemin crystals. This test is not specific for semen, as several substances of animal and vegetable origin give positive results. e. Prostate specific Antigen - PSA/ P30 - A glycoprotein produced by prostatic epithelial cells Detection of PSA – reliable indicator of semen Useful indicator in Azoospermia Microscopic Examination : The only absolute proof of semen is the microscope detection of at least one unbroken sperm. Complete sperms are seen up-to 26 hrs in vagina, in the living, after ejaculation. After 26 hrs, they separate into head and tail. Similarly, after death complete sperms may be found up-to 2 days in vagina and up-to one week in the cervix & uterus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Teichmann's test -will show brown,rhombic crystal. Option C.Takayama test -will show Pink, feathery appearance. Option D.Florence test- will show Brown, Rhombic crystal ,bigger compared to Teichmann’s test.

Extraedge:

Red stain: Luminol spray test (high sensitivity)- test of choice Spectroscopy (high specificity)- Most reliable test White stain: UV light Gold standard: presence of intact sperm under microscope (stain-christmas tree). Azoospermia-raised levels of Prostate specific antigen (P 30) + acid phosphatase.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: A 45 years old man developed generalized muscle spasm and arching backwards as shown in the image. He had a history of consuming seeds a few days back. What is the toxin responsible for this abnormal posturing?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Strychnine Generalized muscle spasm and arching backwards (Opisthotonos) as shown in the image. with a history of consuming seeds pointing towards strychnine poisoning.

Highyeild:

STRYCHNOS NUX VOMICA - All parts of the plant are poisonous, especially fruit and seeds. Each fruit of Nux vomica has about 3 – 5 seeds. Size and shape of the seeds look like buttons on a coat. Active principle : Strychnine Brucine Loganin Mechanism of Action: Site : Anterior horn cells of spinal cord Mechanism : Inhibit Glycine Fatal dose : One crushed seed Fatal period : 1 – 4 hours Clinical Feature : Risus Sardonicus Laughter Mocking Peculiar facial expression Contraction of facial muscles-Corners of mouth are drawn backwards Grinning Convulsions a. Opisthotonos : most common conclusive posture Spasms affect c antigravity muscles Extreme Hyperextension (Backward bending of body) Bow b.Emprosthotonus : Mirror image of opisthotonus Spasm of abdominal muscles Forward bending of body C. Pleurothotonus : Spasm of lateral muscles Side bend of body Person has to be isolated Each convulsion lasts for 2 mins & in between convulsions, the body is completely relaxed. Death occurs following 4 – 5 such convulsions Treatment- Symptoms treated first before disease Pentobarbital sodium Amytal sodium Medicolegal Importance - Bitterness can be detected in 1:70000 given with alcohol – Homicidal Mostly suicidal

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Datura Seeds-causes D's - Delirium,Diplopia ,Dimness of vision,Dilatation of pupilDryness of mouth Dysphagia ,Dysphonia,Dilatation of cutaneous vessels -Flushing of face,Drunken gait,Death due to Resp. failure Option C. Abrus- looks like a viper bite. Option D. Ricinus- causes d iarrhea, colic pain.

Extraedge:

CRITERIA STRYCHNINE TETANUS 1. Action of m/s All m/s are affected simultaneously Trismus first then other m/s 2. Relaxation between convulsion Present Can be detected in body Absent x
